[{'created': '2018-04-05 21:15:14.000000000', 'message': "DNM Test system site package venv with pip10

Do not merge this is testing how pip10 works with system site package'd

commit_message:
DNM Test system site package venv with pip10

Do not merge this is testing how pip10 works with system site package'd
venvs and if distutils system packages cause problems for installs in
the venv.

Change-Id: Iacdd306f31e20aa2d47c46fd2dddbc20d89e5a56

commit_message:
Install OSC into a virtualenv

The total number of packages you have installed affects the runtime of
openstackclient because it uses pkg_resources to find plugins and the
more python packages you have the slower finding plugins is. This is
likely to break any devstack plugin that uses OSC plugins because they
won't install to the correct openstackclient location. But we want to
test if this produces a measurable improvement to devstack runtimes then
worry about backward compat in a future patchset.

Change-Id: Iea80ae97254a70d15aeb7e586acc1bf175dc6a3a
Depends-On: Ic5f1844ce732d447ee980b3c9fdc417f72482609

commit_message:
Allow public router external net to use a non-flat provider network.

Allow users to auto-create a neutron non-flat providernet public network
and use it for external router interfaces.  By default, keep the existing
flat network type behavior.

Change-Id: I5443af153bfd3590f42041f27efcbe845ffd7907
(cherry picked from commit bb7d2f233b92a3f9ee17ad0702fecb68bbf1e712)

[{'created': '2016-03-03 20:51:02.000000000', 'message': 'Set default domain variables in openrc

Creating a devstack with Identity API v2 disabled and
getting credentials from openrc fails, once it does
not set the domain which the project and user belongs to.

This patch adds the variables that signs points to the
default domain.

Change-Id: I6699c47e4cd04882a3af86325ac2f8f39a531914
'}]
commit_message:
Set default domain variables in openrc

Creating a devstack with Identity API v2 disabled and
getting credentials from openrc fails, once it does
not set the domain which the project and user belongs to.

This patch adds the variables that signs points to the
default domain.

Change-Id: I6699c47e4cd04882a3af86325ac2f8f39a531914

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-13 00:28:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fail if RDO fails to install

It's not entirely clear if yum_install should be called outside of
"package_install"; at any rate it is here, and doesn't fail if the
package is missing, leading you on a weird chase trying to determine
why various packages aren't available during the run.  Do the simple
thing of exiting on failure.

Change-Id: I7cf3ed049306f43b2b22fb8f1a71ba0bb34638a9
'}]
commit_message:
Fail if RDO fails to install

It's not entirely clear if yum_install should be called outside of
"package_install"; at any rate it is here, and doesn't fail if the
package is missing, leading you on a weird chase trying to determine
why various packages aren't available during the run.  Do the simple
thing of exiting on failure.

Change-Id: I7cf3ed049306f43b2b22fb8f1a71ba0bb34638a9

commit_message:
[WIP][DNM] Add Ubuntu Xenial ARM64 platform job

This is intended for out-of-tree testing with zuul, and the extensive
modifications to drop jobs are unsuitable for deployment.  In the event
that this seems sensible as a platform job, the job should be defined
as an *addition* to other jobs, rather than as a replacement for so much.

In addition to the listed Depends-on, the job is not expected to succeed
without some manual activities to enable mirrors, etc.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/546434

commit_message:
Add add_image_link common function

Some projects requires adding custom images during stack.sh phase.
Adding them via updating IMAGE_URLS variable requires adding the same
code like checking that image doesn't exist.
This patch adds add_image_link function that check that image link is
uniq among other links and add ',' if needed.

Change-Id: Ibb2f6350975a5b575286e80604831a25a1bee17c

commit_message:
DNM: test failing role test

This validates that the new test runner for the write-devstack-local-conf
role can correctly fail the unit test job.

Change-Id: Ib0bc9c4d79c6781237461af674ff50cbf9891887

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-09 18:58:17.000000000', 'message': "Enables the user to set arch for the baremetal flavor and ironic node

Users now can set architecture for target node and flavor by adding
IRONIC_HW_ARCH in the local.conf file. The option defaults to x86_64

Also uses CIRROS_ARCH variable to the ironic images as it's already used
in regular builds where libvirt is the virt driver.

commit_message:
Enables the user to set arch for the baremetal flavor and ironic node

Users now can set architecture for target node and flavor by adding
IRONIC_HW_ARCH in the local.conf file. The option defaults to x86_64

Also uses CIRROS_ARCH variable to the ironic images as it's already used
in regular builds where libvirt is the virt driver.

Change-Id: Ia77be8e20c16cdd055bfccf4819b472569164efb

- Recognize sle12 as a SUSE distro

- in sle12, /etc/my.cnf is installed with very
restrictive permissions.
"sudo" needs to be used to make any changes
to it.

- Convert os_release to integer before comparing
because bash cannot use "-lt" operator on decimals.

Change-Id: Id549cfdacf448c0c1615866b40701aa0d77fdcd2
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for SUSE sle12

- Recognize sle12 as a SUSE distro

- in sle12, /etc/my.cnf is installed with very
restrictive permissions.
"sudo" needs to be used to make any changes
to it.

- Convert os_release to integer before comparing
because bash cannot use "-lt" operator on decimals.

Change-Id: Id549cfdacf448c0c1615866b40701aa0d77fdcd2

This commit allows the usage of a new var for setting additional neutron
service plugins, such as trunk.

Change-Id: I9aada62b37e446f242a00917d077a3c9f1967e07
Signed-off-by: Daniel Mellado <dmellado@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-07-18 13:05:48.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Allow setting additional neutron service plugins

commit_message:
[WIP] Allow setting additional neutron service plugins

This commit allows the usage of a new var for setting additional neutron
service plugins, such as trunk.

Change-Id: I9aada62b37e446f242a00917d077a3c9f1967e07
Signed-off-by: Daniel Mellado <dmellado@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix create-stack-user.sh failed

create-stack-user.sh source stackrc, which will campare host_ip with
10.0.0.0/24 when both FIXED_RANGE and HOST_IP are unset, this compare
will cause error when you host ip is belongs to 10.0.0.0/24.
create-stack-user.sh shouldn't be impact by it.

Fix it by assign STACK_USER and DEST in create-stack-user.sh
instead of source stackrc.

Change-Id: I666f7309ebf0b376ffd9dfccf5c077065b35ba21
Closes-Bug: 1600073

commit_message:
Driver for neutron metering cannot be tuned in devstack

Following modification is included in this patch.
* Make driver to be tunable.
* Set IptablesMeteringDriver as default driver.
* Set OVSInterfaceDriver as default interface driver.

Change-Id: I3266e9ad4cf605a7854fefe88121547ebf873392
Closes-bug: #1360963

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-09-25 12:21:35.000000000', 'message': 'Allow for chown & chmod operations on DEST to be toggled

If you are using libvirt + NFS, this step can take quite a long time,
or if you are using libvirt + passthrough filesystems, you really
don't want this to run this.

This is due to the nfs check only checking if the root dir is
nfs. some setups have a local /opt/stack with other
directories nfs mounted into /opt/stack, and as such the
"is_nfs_directory" test allows the chmod / chown to run.

This allows users to disable these operations by setting

  CHOWN_DEST & CHMOD_DEST to False

Change-Id: Ia10abd70e712d42ff78117bac932685ef119fbbd
'}]
commit_message:
Allow for chown & chmod operations on DEST to be toggled

If you are using libvirt + NFS, this step can take quite a long time,
or if you are using libvirt + passthrough filesystems, you really
don't want this to run this.

This is due to the nfs check only checking if the root dir is
nfs. some setups have a local /opt/stack with other
directories nfs mounted into /opt/stack, and as such the
"is_nfs_directory" test allows the chmod / chown to run.

This allows users to disable these operations by setting

  CHOWN_DEST & CHMOD_DEST to False

Change-Id: Ia10abd70e712d42ff78117bac932685ef119fbbd

commit_message:
Run OSC flavor create in parallel

Each invocation of OSC takes about 3-4 seconds. We run 10 of them just
to create nova's flavors. That comes out to about 30 seconds if we are
lucky. Or we can run them in parallel on 8 cpus and spend ~6 seconds
making flavors.

Use xargs to run things in parallel since it is a quick and easy way to
do so when you don't care about the process output (it will still exit
with an error if any subcommand errored). Note that this won't work with
the timing capturing code that sdague wrote for this reason.

Change-Id: I19a865388bc791758a2585264d81d4e620dea2ff

Remove the suffix of *console*

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints from in review changes

Currently upper-constraints.txt is not getting used
from in-review changes of requirements project and
leading to merge of broken requirements[1].

Use master branch to fetch constraints instead of
the remote branch.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/822575

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/823128
Change-Id: I5d42ac6b54bf20804d7e5faa39d1289102318b64

commit_message:
Sync vars from redhat.yml to redhat-9.yml

In terms of EL9, it first loads redhat-9.yaml var and ignores
the redhat.yaml var.
It ignores the installation of podman packages and which further
leads to missing directories.

By syncing the required vars from redhat.yml to redhat-9.yml
fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1955962

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6c520f31c8f7d720f090596faac0277faa00f90d

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-23 18:20:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix reinstall quickstart/extras upon bootstrap

When `quickstart.sh` is called to bootstrap, make sure
the needed release config files and quickstart-extras roles,
like extras-common, are installed by the expected paths.

That fixes an issue with tripleo CI reproducer, when
toci script fails when ansible fails to locate
/home/zuul/workspace/.quickstart/usr/local/share/ansible/roles
when it runs more that once on the same host.

Change-Id: Ia8bb088ce6f9ddda00dcddf868d1bc1eb15dd7f9
Related-bug: #1955574
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-12-23 18:48:54.000000000', 'message': 'Reinstall quickstart if config dir is overwritten

When running jobs twice on same machine in reproducer, there is
a conflict between repeating reinstall of quickstart and extras.
If config/ directory is overwritten, reinstall quickstart again.

Change-Id: Ia8bb088ce6f9ddda00dcddf868d1bc1eb15dd7f9
Related-bug: #1955574
'}, {'created': '2021-12-23 19:08:42.000000000', 'message': 'Reinstall quickstart if config dir is overwritten

When running jobs twice on same machine in reproducer, there is
a conflict between repeating reinstall of quickstart and extras.
If config/ directory is overwritten, reinstall quickstart again.

Change-Id: Ia8bb088ce6f9ddda00dcddf868d1bc1eb15dd7f9
Related-bug: #1955574
'}, {'created': '2021-12-25 02:16:08.000000000', 'message': 'Reinstall quickstart if config dir is overwritten

When running jobs twice on same machine in reproducer, there is
a conflict between repeating reinstall of quickstart and extras.
If config/ directory is overwritten, reinstall quickstart again.

Change-Id: Ia8bb088ce6f9ddda00dcddf868d1bc1eb15dd7f9
Related-bug: #1955574
'}, {'created': '2021-12-25 02:24:43.000000000', 'message': "Reinstall quickstart-extras if it is removed

When running jobs twice on same machine in reproducer, there is
a conflict between reinstall of quickstart and quickstart-extras.
If extras roles don't exist, reinstall quickstart-extras again.

Change-Id: Ia8bb088ce6f9ddda00dcddf868d1bc1eb15dd7f9
Close-Bug: #1955574
"}, {'created': '2021-12-25 02:24:55.000000000', 'message': "Reinstall quickstart-extras if it is removed

When running jobs twice on same machine in reproducer, there is
a conflict between reinstall of quickstart and quickstart-extras.

Closes-Bug: #1955574
"}, {'created': '2021-12-27 15:05:51.000000000', 'message': "Reinstall quickstart-extras if it is removed

When running jobs twice on same machine in reproducer, there is
a conflict between reinstall of quickstart and quickstart-extras.
If extras roles don't exist, reinstall quickstart-extras again.

Change-Id: Ia8bb088ce6f9ddda00dcddf868d1bc1eb15dd7f9
Closes-Bug: #1955574
"}]
commit_message:
Reinstall quickstart-extras if it is removed

When running jobs twice on same machine in reproducer, there is
a conflict between reinstall of quickstart and quickstart-extras.
If extras roles don't exist, reinstall quickstart-extras again.

Change-Id: Ia8bb088ce6f9ddda00dcddf868d1bc1eb15dd7f9
Closes-Bug: #1955574

commit_message:
Revert upper-constraint of paramiko to release 2.9.1

This partially reverts [1], as paramiko-2.9.1 caused
issues in tempest jobs where cirros image is used[1].
Also u-c updates are not getting testing so would also
need [3] to get it fixed.

To get [3] land we would need to merge this requirements
change first and hence switch tempest-full job non-voting
and removing from gate pipeline.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/822575
[2] https://github.com/cirros-dev/cirros/issues/74
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/823127

Change-Id: I62350b017f91f827b7a20c78b8c4fee9113d659f

commit_message:
Accept system scope credentials for Keystone API request

This change is the first step to support secure RBAC and allows usage
of system scope credentials for Keystone API request.

This change covers the following two items.
 - assignment of system scope roles to system user
 - credential parameters for authtoken middleware

Note that the credential parameters for authtoken middleware are
used in some providers, and these providers still require a project
scope credential. This will be fixed by the subsequent change.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/804325
Change-Id: I8b73f04bd10d0129c7437c6f9c6a436b6171f39d

Add config_template collection

In order to pass left fuctional tests we need to make collection
resolvable. This is also useful for backporting, as
functional tests retrieve latest infra roles.

commit_message:
Add config_template collection

In order to pass left fuctional tests we need to make collection
resolvable. This is also useful for backporting, as
functional tests retrieve latest infra roles.

Change-Id: I984a98bffff195f2af88365c025b8aaced9f3a49

commit_message:
Do not set default value for tempest_private_net_seg_id

It is generally better idea to not set tempest_private_net_seg_id by default for vxlan network(which is the default type for private net) and let openstack automatically choose segmentation id

Change-Id: Ie08e2a612711a57d74dca3e13d1d4223fd441989

commit_message:
Updating python testing classifier as per Yoga testing runtime

Yoga testing runtime[1] has been updated to add py39
testing as voting. Unit tests update are handled by the
job template change in openstack-zuul-job

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/820286

this commit updates the classifier in setup.cfg file.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/yoga.html

Change-Id: Ia8b7f322eec1f3120c71ee03771f87e60cdea311

commit_message:
Fix variable name

TrivialFix

The customization format of the variable name should contain the
<image_name> [1]. This change fixes the name of the 'remote_apt_keys'
variable in base Dockerfile.

1. https://docs.openstack.org/kolla/latest/admin/image-building.html#dockerfile-customisation

Change-Id: I423db39e77f337a73d3d88e3dbd56469be45110b
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit cb99f46929298f8e1d939cfca2a1d4831cd1efca)

commit_message:
Add config_template collection

In order to pass left fuctional tests we need to make collection
resolvable. This is also useful for backporting, as
functional tests retrieve latest infra roles.

Change-Id: I984a98bffff195f2af88365c025b8aaced9f3a49

subject: Make mistral reproducible
messages: [{'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2021-12-28 18:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-28 18:27:54.000000000', 'message': 'Make mistral reproducible

Whilst working on the Reproducible Builds effort [0] we noticed that
mistral could not be built reproducibly.

This is because some help output enumerated the constants in a Python
set without a sort which does not have an implicitly deterministic
ordering. Patch attached that applies a sort to the list.

 [0] https://reproducible-builds.org/

Note this was reported in Debian at:
https://bugs.debian.org/960591

and was fixed in the Debian package.

Change-Id: Icb899483021777724462e926732a182f2a3390b0
'}]
commit_message:
Make mistral reproducible

Whilst working on the Reproducible Builds effort [0] we noticed that
mistral could not be built reproducibly.

This is because some help output enumerated the constants in a Python
set without a sort which does not have an implicitly deterministic
ordering. Patch attached that applies a sort to the list.

 [0] https://reproducible-builds.org/

Note this was reported in Debian at:
https://bugs.debian.org/960591

and was fixed in the Debian package.

Change-Id: Icb899483021777724462e926732a182f2a3390b0

commit_message:
Fix variable name

TrivialFix

The customization format of the variable name should contain the
<image_name> [1]. This change fixes the name of the 'remote_apt_keys'
variable in base Dockerfile.

1. https://docs.openstack.org/kolla/latest/admin/image-building.html#dockerfile-customisation

Change-Id: I423db39e77f337a73d3d88e3dbd56469be45110b
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

subject: Fix galera_force_bootstrap behaviour
messages:
[{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-12-24 14:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-12-24 16:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2021-12-25 05:22:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2021-12-26 12:57:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-12-28 10:52:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-12-28 13:04:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-24 14:50:05.000000000', 'message': "Fix galera_force_bootstrap behaviour

Currently, ``galera_force_bootstrap`` fuctionality is eqivalent to
``galera_ignore_cluster_state`` and not really functional.
We add extra conditions to cluster bootstrap handlers that allow
to force bootstrap cluster when it's already running.

This could also be leveraged while stretching galera cluster.

commit_message:
Fix galera_force_bootstrap behaviour

Currently, ``galera_force_bootstrap`` fuctionality is eqivalent to
``galera_ignore_cluster_state`` and not really functional.
We add extra conditions to cluster bootstrap handlers that allow
to force bootstrap cluster when it's already running.

This could also be leveraged while stretching galera cluster.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-role-python_venv_build/+/821415
Change-Id: I0380782a034d291fd2173c2ae59fdfb8f4468bf0

commit_message:
Update ansible-core to 2.12.1

ansible-core>=2.12 has a requirement of Python 3.8 which
is not default for CentOS 8 Stream.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-role-python_venv_build/+/822998
Change-Id: I97f472b27e0a3b41d10d734a253664c86b8fa751

commit_message:
Add boto3 module for s3 backend

This patch adds the boto3 python module, which is a dependency
for the s3 glance backend.

Closes-Bug: #1955683
Change-Id: I5f5a921d8a08d5dfb09e2bca71d49c85115a60aa

Define _glance_available_stores in variables

Glance available stores is usefull outsie of the template as well, so we
move defining variable from Jinja template only to ansible variables.

commit_message:
Fix conflict between tq and tqe directories

When reinstalling tq and tqe there is conflict with config/
directory, which is populated by both repos. Fix it by specifying
exactly what to install in tqe.
Related-bug: #1955574
Change-Id: I0b1d85e83b51ef86f245f237dd72dd5306d2f79e

subject: Replace virtualenv with exacutable for pip
messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-12-27 08:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2021-12-27 19:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-12-28 10:50:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-27 08:17:52.000000000', 'message': "Replace virtualenv with exacutable for pip

We create virtualenv with a separate command since we need to create
constraints before running pip. In the meanwhile when using pyenv
it becomes more messy to use virtualenv, as it would require
setting virtualenv_command and you can't define virtualenv_python then.

Using exacutable requires setuptools to be present
for ansible_python_interpreter

Change-Id: I5bf617ad0eca3dd5e58e25af7b44d536dc4579d3
"}]
commit_message:
Replace virtualenv with exacutable for pip

We create virtualenv with a separate command since we need to create
constraints before running pip. In the meanwhile when using pyenv
it becomes more messy to use virtualenv, as it would require
setting virtualenv_command and you can't define virtualenv_python then.

Using exacutable requires setuptools to be present
for ansible_python_interpreter

Change-Id: I5bf617ad0eca3dd5e58e25af7b44d536dc4579d3

commit_message:
Keystone: Remove unused container_puppet_tasks

This was introduced to manage keystone resources (users, projects and
so on) by puppet but now these resources are managed by ansible.

Conflicts:
	deployment/keystone/keystone-container-puppet.yaml

Resolved conflict caused by e329ca915ebf9e9a061c5d9b9141ed7a22fcda37 .

Change-Id: I9e76f21e41e2891f959cbf41b89cba07b2e67632
(cherry picked from commit 925e2db462c76b01f46611b8052e127d9d61b408)
(cherry picked from commit 48d547ce7c26a56fffd1f73e9548c5b263dae8d4)
(cherry picked from commit 432968ba612a42673a0bec47f0988c66daaa8dc6)

subject: Fix IPv6 router on UC re-install
messages: [{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-12-23 09:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-12-28 08:17:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-23 09:11:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix IPv6 router on UC re-install

Running 'openstack undercloud install' a second
time failed with a ConflictException because a subnet
with a router port cannot have the gateway_ip updated.

Ensure that the router port is always deleted prior to
the subnet update and then add the router port again
after updating the subnet

Closes-Bug: #1955417
Change-Id: I0e075153e99876ddf613caecc92b4442e8b6ca03
(cherry picked from commit 62ded067d53f8e12591f5ef7392b472cb8e9e985)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix IPv6 router on UC re-install

Running 'openstack undercloud install' a second
time failed with a ConflictException because a subnet
with a router port cannot have the gateway_ip updated.

Ensure that the router port is always deleted prior to
the subnet update and then add the router port again
after updating the subnet

Closes-Bug: #1955417
Change-Id: I0e075153e99876ddf613caecc92b4442e8b6ca03
(cherry picked from commit 62ded067d53f8e12591f5ef7392b472cb8e9e985)

testing as voting. Unit tests update are handled by the
job template change in openstack-zuul-job

[{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-12-28 09:46:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-12-28 09:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-12-28 09:54:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-12-28 10:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Will create a new unpin patch instead of reverting'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-28 09:46:22.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Pin td-agent to 4.0.* to fix missing logs"

This reverts commit 6d0882ef799bb531d007c3e6839ef318fd512d5c.

Reason for revert: Running with outdated versions isn't a long-term solution, let us unpin and see whether we can fix the issue properly.

commit_message:
Revert "Pin td-agent to 4.0.* to fix missing logs"

This reverts commit 6d0882ef799bb531d007c3e6839ef318fd512d5c.

Reason for revert: Running with outdated versions isn't a long-term
solution, let us unpin and see whether we can fix the issue properly.

[{'created': '2021-06-07 11:08:55.000000000', 'message': "Pin td-agent to 4.0.* to fix missing logs

The release inclusion of Fluentd 1.12.x in Centos/Ubuntu packages
causes a significant number of logs to fail to appear in the
Elasticsearch or Monasca output plugins. The logs appear to
sit in a local buffer, and are only flushed when Fluentd is
restarted. The same issue persists in the most recent release
(1.13.0), so for now we pin the td-agent package to 4.0.* which
should restrict Fluentd to the 1.11.x release where we don't
see this issue.

Change-Id: Iefcdd3100b7e3c5320bc5f1286a18251bdeab885

commit_message:
Pin td-agent to 4.0.* to fix missing logs

The recent inclusion of Fluentd 1.12.x in Centos/Ubuntu packages
causes a significant number of logs to fail to appear in the
Elasticsearch or Monasca output plugins. The logs appear to
sit in a local buffer, and are only flushed when Fluentd is
restarted. The same issue persists in the most recent release
(1.13.0), so for now we pin the td-agent package to 4.0.* which
should restrict Fluentd to the 1.11.x release where we don't
see this issue.

Backport to Victoria.

Change-Id: Iefcdd3100b7e3c5320bc5f1286a18251bdeab885
Closes-Bug: #1930867

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Change-Id: I385fc837787c79f0db9caf1a911d27ab4c033603
Closes-Bug: #1863021

commit_message:
Remove Monasca Log Metrics service

This service was deprecated in the Wallaby release and we
can now start removing it if it hasn't already been removed.

Change-Id: I7d825906edc4b78677d839942cba3a158f44b2e2

'}, {'created': '2021-08-12 06:01:50.000000000', 'message': "Add support for the system_scope parameter

This change introduces support for the nww system_scope parameter, so
that we can define keystone user credentials to use system scope token
instead of project scope token. The parameter is currently disabled by
default but it is likely that we'll update the default in the future
when all services enforce secure RBAC by default.

Change-Id: Id43eeb31424f04d6969a993704e5a5c175eb1cb0

This change introduces support for the new system_scope parameter, so
that we can define keystone user credentials to use system scope token
instead of project scope token.

Change-Id: Id43eeb31424f04d6969a993704e5a5c175eb1cb0
'}, {'created': '2021-08-13 05:14:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for system scope

This change is the initial work to support enforcing secure RBAC(SRBAC)
feature and allows system users to be system admins instead of project
admins.

The following two changes are made by this change.

- The keystone_user_role resource type now supports creating a user
  with system roles. This resource previously support only project
  roles and domain roles.

- Some define resource types for are updated so that the other puppet
  modules can define keystone credentials for system scope access
  instead of project scope access.

Note that this change has not yet updated the usage of project scope
tokens in each providers, and that should be fixed later to enforce
SRBAC completely.

Change-Id: Id43eeb31424f04d6969a993704e5a5c175eb1cb0
'}, {'created': '2021-08-13 05:15:48.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for system scope

This change is the initial work to support enforcing secure RBAC(SRBAC)
feature and allows system users to be system admins instead of project
admins.

The following two changes are made by this change.

- The keystone_user_role resource type now supports creating system
  roles. This resource previously support only project roles and domain
  roles.

- Some define resource types for are updated so that the other puppet
  modules can define keystone credentials for system scope access
  instead of project scope access.

Note that this change has not yet updated the usage of project scope
tokens in each providers, and that should be fixed later to enforce

Change-Id: Id43eeb31424f04d6969a993704e5a5c175eb1cb0

'}, {'created': '2021-08-26 10:30:16.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for system scope

This change is the initial work to support enforcing secure RBAC(SRBAC)
feature. The following two changes are made by this change.

- The keystone_user_role resource type now supports creating system
  roles in addition to project roles and domain roles. The following
  example shows how to assign the "admin" role to the "nova" user for
  the system scope "all".

  keystone_user_role{'nova@::::all':
    ensure => 'present',
    roles  => ['admin'],
  }

- Some defined resource types were updated so that the other puppet
  modules can define keystone credentials for system scope access
  instead of project scope access.

Note that this change does not update the usage of project scope
credentials in each providers, and that should be fixed later to
enforce SRBAC completely.

commit_message:
Add support for system scope

This change is the initial work to support enforcing secure RBAC(SRBAC)
feature. The following two changes are made by this change.

- The keystone_user_role resource type now supports creating system
  roles in addition to project roles and domain roles. The following
  example shows how to assign the "admin" role to the "nova" user for
  the system scope "all".

  keystone_user_role{'nova@::::all':
    ensure => 'present',
    roles  => ['admin'],
  }

- Some defined resource types were updated so that the other puppet
  modules can define keystone credentials for system scope access
  instead of project scope access.

Note that this change does not update the usage of project scope
credentials in each providers, and that should be fixed later to
enforce SRBAC completely.

Change-Id: Id43eeb31424f04d6969a993704e5a5c175eb1cb0

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-20 21:51:27.000000000', 'message': "feat(helm-toolkit): add support for image pull secrets

At the moment it is very difficult to pull images from a private
registry that hasn't been configured on Kubernetes nodes as there
is no way to specify imagePullSecrets on pods.

This change introduces a snippet that can return a set of image
pull secrets using either a default or a pod per value. It also
adds this new snippet to the manifests for standard job types.

Change-Id: I710e1feffdf837627b80bc14320751f743e048cb

commit_message:
feat(helm-toolkit): add support for image pull secrets

At the moment it is very difficult to pull images from a private
registry that hasn't been configured on Kubernetes nodes as there
is no way to specify imagePullSecrets on pods.

This change introduces a snippet that can return a set of image
pull secrets using either a default or a per pod value. It also
adds this new snippet to the manifests for standard job types.

Change-Id: I710e1feffdf837627b80bc14320751f743e048cb

Initial commit to Vault role

This adds basic installation of Hashicorps Vault service, using
MySQL as a storage backend.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/800787

Implements: blueprint protecting-plaintext-configs
Change-Id: I23a32ab4ce3314ea00c3ddf479387d2ef2903a7f

[{'created': '2021-05-20 06:12:34.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ie843a199ff119327b65dea8fd208047580430de1

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ie843a199ff119327b65dea8fd208047580430de1

commit_message:
Install cron job to purge soft-deleted records

This change introduces support for configuring cron job to purge
soft-deleted records in Watcher DB, to avoid data size from growing.

Change-Id: I0ad1ba3c96c1b8a090029976446b8496588f31da

commit_message:
Stop creating non-keystone admin endpoints

The admin interface for endpoints never had any real use, the
functionality was the same as for the public or internal endpoints,
except for Keystone. Even for Keystone with API v3 it would no longer
really be needed, but it is still being required by some libraries that
cannot be changed in order to stay backwards compatible.

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>

commit_message:
Make sure the file permissions are correct for barbican

If we use httpd to start the barbican api service, the user of the container
should be root, which will cause incorrect log file permissions.

Signed-off-by: guozijian <guozijian@unitedstack.com>
Change-Id: I7c8eee1465790f6b8562cfce4f904890715bdac0

commit_message:
ovn: set allowed_address_pairs to addresses also

Currently Neutron only sets allowed_address_pairs only to port_security field
in OVN NB DB, but only adds new macs to addresses field - this breaks
allowed_address_pairs functionality.

Closes-Bug: #1908382
Change-Id: Ib02ee77c69e0c014ac5af7ad7fcb42f3bdcd6bae

subject: Pass valid IP address to os-brick
messages: [{'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-12-27 06:25:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-12-27 08:30:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-27 06:25:10.000000000', 'message': "Pass valid IP address to os-brick

While fetching connector information the cinder driver of
glance-store is passing 'hostname' as IP address whereas it
actually needs IP address.

This path fetches the IPV4 or IPV6 address from the available
'hostname' and passes it to os-brick.

This worked for other cinder backends which don't rely specifically
on IP address for initializing connection like fibre channel, nfs etc
and even for some iscsi backends since, in some environments,
the hostname is same as the ip address. This is not the case always
and we should pass the correct IPv4/IPv6 address of the host to
avoid this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1955668

Change-Id: Ic79815972e654a8bfe2775f57c68cfa0bf115e2f
(cherry picked from commit 8b4d97a6f7ce0805a430dac6756495db7a5aacb4)
"}]
commit_message:
Pass valid IP address to os-brick

While fetching connector information the cinder driver of
glance-store is passing 'hostname' as IP address whereas it
actually needs IP address.

This path fetches the IPV4 or IPV6 address from the available
'hostname' and passes it to os-brick.

This worked for other cinder backends which don't rely specifically
on IP address for initializing connection like fibre channel, nfs etc
and even for some iscsi backends since, in some environments,
the hostname is same as the ip address. This is not the case always
and we should pass the correct IPv4/IPv6 address of the host to
avoid this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1955668

Change-Id: Ic79815972e654a8bfe2775f57c68cfa0bf115e2f
(cherry picked from commit 8b4d97a6f7ce0805a430dac6756495db7a5aacb4)

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim
support for Python 3.5 in the classifier.
This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv.

Change-Id: I0be6222cd66fc041589c615417283e8d45a8bec3

[{'created': '2020-05-05 22:16:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(stein, train, ussuri) use the Tempest and plugins master
version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:

commit_message:
Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(stein, train, ussuri) use the Tempest and plugins master
version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/
e8f1876aa6772077f85f380677b30251c2454505/.zuul.yaml#L646

Change-Id: I7ec9f18684350d642ccc12ff4cea445600e24c78

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-22 07:51:08.000000000', 'message': '[Stable only] Fix callback function arguments

Fixes [1] and [2] for bug [3] are using new callabacks mechanism and
expects payload as one of the arguments passed to the callback functions.
This works fine in Xena+ releases but not in Wallaby and olders where
old callbacks mechanism is still used, at least for the security group
AFTER_DELETE events.
So this patch fixes that by changing to the old callbacks mechanism in
the logging service plugin in stable/wallaby and older branches only.

Closes-Bug: #1955546

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/804237
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/812459
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1939558

Change-Id: I0003bd566dc769436ad1342351ad058394bd52da
'}]
commit_message:
[Stable only] Fix callback function arguments

Fixes [1] and [2] for bug [3] are using new callabacks mechanism and
expects payload as one of the arguments passed to the callback functions.
This works fine in Xena+ releases but not in Wallaby and olders where
old callbacks mechanism is still used, at least for the security group
AFTER_DELETE events.
So this patch fixes that by changing to the old callbacks mechanism in
the logging service plugin in stable/wallaby and older branches only.

Closes-Bug: #1955546

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/804237
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/812459
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1939558

Change-Id: I0003bd566dc769436ad1342351ad058394bd52da

commit_message:
Deprecate ironic::pxe::enable_ppc64le

The boolean parameter ironic::pxe::enable_ppc64le is now undefined and
setting it has no effect. Previously, setting it to true resulted in
the creation of /tftpboot/ppc64le/. This directory is only required
for the creation of inspector file /tftpboot/ppc64le/default. For this
reason the directory creation is moved to inspector.pp and both are
created when ironic::inspector::enable_ppc64le is set to true.

Change-Id: I52e02f0ce21a88288cf97244dfb6f0d664b643dc

commit_message:
Allow to provide conditions for certificates

Some certificates needs to be installed or generated only on specific
hosts or under specific conditions.
To make structure passed to the role less complicated, we allow to
provide condition key for pki_install_certificates and pki_certificates.

Change-Id: I44c55d1aa2c6fd79537a5e82892cd9da958ea43d

subject: compute: Fix weird option definition for 'server ssh'
messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-12-15 17:44:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-12-25 09:17:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-15 17:44:19.000000000', 'message': "compute: Fix weird option definition for 'server ssh'

argparse allows you to specify multiple options for a given argument
when declaring the argument. For some reason, we weren't doing this for
the 'server ssh' command. There's no apparent reason for doing things
this way and it's been that way since the beginning (2013) so let's not
do that.

We also add unit tests since they were missing and should exist.

Change-Id: I67a9e6516d7057266210cd4083e9ddeb1cfaa5de
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
compute: Fix weird option definition for 'server ssh'

argparse allows you to specify multiple options for a given argument
when declaring the argument. For some reason, we weren't doing this for
the 'server ssh' command. There's no apparent reason for doing things
this way and it's been that way since the beginning (2013) so let's not
do that.

We also add unit tests since they were missing and should exist.

Change-Id: I67a9e6516d7057266210cd4083e9ddeb1cfaa5de
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Switch add fixed IP to SDK

Switch the add fixed IP command from novaclient to SDK.

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-25 12:54:25.000000000', 'message': 'Pass through args to ssh

Why limit a user to preset ssh arguments? Capture them all and send
them along to ssh to deal with. This allows users to use the full range of
ssh arguments, incluidng specifying a command to run on the
instance.

Example:
openstack server ssh upg -- -l cirros -i ~/id_rsa_test "date; uptime"

Change-Id: Ia50786d5eee52688e180550fe16aeb8af610154b
'}, {'created': '2016-11-25 13:17:47.000000000', 'message': 'Pass through args to ssh

Why limit a user to preset ssh arguments? Capture them all and send
them along to ssh to deal with. This allows users to use the full range of
ssh arguments, incluidng specifying a command to run on the
instance.

Example:
openstack server ssh -4 upg -- -l cirros -i ~/id_rsa_upg "date; uptime"

Change-Id: Ia50786d5eee52688e180550fe16aeb8af610154b
'}, {'created': '2016-11-25 15:01:34.000000000', 'message': 'Pass through args to ssh

commit_message:
compute: Pass through args to ssh

Why limit a user to preset ssh arguments? Capture them all and send
them along to ssh to deal with. This allows users to use the full range of
ssh arguments, including specifying a command to run on the
instance. For example:

  openstack server ssh -4 upg -- -l cirros -i ~/id_rsa_upg "date; uptime"

SSH arguments that openstackclient currently mirrors are deprecated
except for -4 and -6, as they are useful for retrieving the correct
instance IP.

Change-Id: Ia50786d5eee52688e180550fe16aeb8af610154b
Co-authored-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen@that.guru>

commit_message:
Updating python testing classifier as per Yoga testing runtime

Yoga testing runtime[1] has been updated to add py39
testing as voting. Unit tests update are handled by the
job template change in openstack-zuul-job

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/820286

this commit updates the classifier in setup.cfg file.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/yoga.html

Change-Id: I1c5735e598bbe6398186381f1584859ef7cc1d4d

commit_message:
Install python3-venv on destination hosts

python3-venv is a requirement for destination hosts, not only build host.
Thus, we introduce new variable `venv_install_base_distro_package_list`
which acts simmilar way to `venv_build_base_distro_package_list`
except it's installs packages for install hosts as well.

Change-Id: I64843518b39f930f6983ab51bb3d053c04e6b8ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-10 15:00:31.000000000', 'message': "Verify that wheels are normally built

Infra team has reported that OSA deployments use to DDoS gitea.
During some investigation we discovered that the potential workflow that
lead to DDoS was incorrect order during upgrade, when
compute nodes were upgraded before controllers and thus
each compute node was independently pulling same repos as no repo
server was available to this specific OS version.

Based on that we're implementing check that allows such behaviour only
if it's performed in a serial manner.
Undocumented variable `venv_wheel_build_skip_check` is added for cases
when local repos are used for service deployment and limitation should
not be applicable.

Change-Id: I54b2d4bdf6d101cc72c92be196962902a6138757
"}, {'created': '2021-12-14 16:53:20.000000000', 'message': "Verify that wheels are normally built

commit_message:
Verify that wheels are built while running against multiple hosts

Infra team has reported that OSA deployments use to DDoS gitea.
During some investigation we discovered that the potential workflow that
lead to DDoS was incorrect order during upgrade, when
compute nodes were upgraded before controllers and thus
each compute node was independently pulling same repos as no repo
server was available to this specific OS version.

Based on that we're implementing check that allows such behaviour only
if it's performed in a serial manner.
Undocumented variable `venv_wheel_build_skip_check` is added for cases
when local repos are used for service deployment and limitation should
not be applicable.

Change-Id: I54b2d4bdf6d101cc72c92be196962902a6138757

commit_message:
Only install required/supported fence agents

This change replaces fence-agents-all package to fence-agents-redfish,
fence-agents-ipmilan, fence-agents-kdump and fence-agents-rhevm.

The same is proposed in
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements/+/818184

This change also fixes failure in unit tests, caused by the following
warning message shown by the pcs command.

Warning: stonith option 'passwd' is deprecated and should not be used,
use 'password' instead

Closes-Bug: #1955559
Related-Bug: #1955572
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8f5c04cea4afb8f46a8da5ab639ac984bac36cca

commit_message:
Update notes on how to enable TLS for VNC

Add warning to security docs about enabling TLS for VNC on
existing deployments, as this can prevent console access
to existing virtual machines.

Change-Id: Ib9e6a9fc4de2e3013e19f7eb252aacd5ae70d4d4
(cherry picked from commit 15bd4920ed5fc766d857b7ccc42c2c525397f401)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-22 14:23:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add release note issue for no console access when TLS for VNC enabled

For existing deployments if TLS for VNC is enabled console access
is lost because changes do not apply to running vms.

The release note issue covers the possible solutions.

Change-Id: I0a79c2b4884e7cb60d5e4cc3c49d440545f9003a
'}]
commit_message:
Add release note issue for no console access when TLS for VNC enabled

For existing deployments if TLS for VNC is enabled console access
is lost because changes do not apply to running vms.

The release note issue covers the possible solutions.

Change-Id: I0a79c2b4884e7cb60d5e4cc3c49d440545f9003a

commit_message:
Change get_readiness_state() return type

Remove the usage of the bool() method as it wasn't behaving as expected
- bool("False") returns True instead of False.

The get_readiness_state() method was returning a string when
container_name wasn't None and it's been changed to return a boolean
instead.
container.ready param is already a Boolean but condition.status is a
string.

Increase the timeout waiting for pods to be ready after scaling in the
scale_deployment() method.

Change-Id: Ie64f868b877ca4c9f1ff8916360638f013fc2926

Updated port_pool test

commit_message:
Remove surplus function for getting lb client.

In this patch we removing function which can be replaced by directly
getting openstacksdk client from cached clients, instead of calling a
function which would fetch it for us.

commit_message:
[Stable only] Fix callback function arguments

Fixes [1] and [2] for bug [3] are using new callabacks mechanism and
expects payload as one of the arguments passed to the callback functions.
This works fine in Xena+ releases but not in Wallaby and olders where
old callbacks mechanism is still used, at least for the security group
AFTER_DELETE events.
So this patch fixes that by changing to the old callbacks mechanism in
the logging service plugin in stable/wallaby and older branches only.

Closes-Bug: #1955546

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/804237
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/812459
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1939558

Change-Id: I0003bd566dc769436ad1342351ad058394bd52da

commit_message:
[Stable only] Fix callback function arguments

Fixes [1] and [2] for bug [3] are using new callabacks mechanism and
expects payload as one of the arguments passed to the callback functions.
This works fine in Xena+ releases but not in Wallaby and olders where
old callbacks mechanism is still used, at least for the security group
AFTER_DELETE events.
So this patch fixes that by changing to the old callbacks mechanism in
the logging service plugin in stable/wallaby and older branches only.

Closes-Bug: #1955546

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/804237
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/812459
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1939558

Change-Id: I0003bd566dc769436ad1342351ad058394bd52da

commit_message:
Remove glance_api_servers from ironic.conf

The [glance]glance_api_servers configuration option has been deprecated
since Pike and removed in 2019 per Ironic commit
dcfb4f10f31c11afa350ef6418a0e12e6be6e5b2. Removing from ironic.conf
template.

Change-Id: I3b09514635ee0c8665c425bd1fe42fb594361a0e

commit_message:
Add py39 to tox.ini

Yoga testing runtime has been updated to add py39

"}, {'created': '2021-12-23 16:22:44.000000000', 'message': "Pass ip and host correctly to os-brick

passes the host in the ip field and doesn't pass the ip address at all.
This patch corrects the behavior of passing right values to right fields

Closes-Bug: #1955668

Change-Id: Ic79815972e654a8bfe2775f57c68cfa0bf115e2f
"}, {'created': '2021-12-23 16:45:51.000000000', 'message': "Pass valid IP address to os-brick

While fetching connector information the cinder driver of
glance-store is passing 'hostname' as IP address whereas it
actually needs IP address.

This path fetches the IPV4 or IPV6 address from the available
'hostname' and passes it to os-brick.

This worked for other cinder backends which don't rely specifically
on IP address for initializing connection like fibre channel, nfs etc
and even for some iscsi backends since, in some environments,
the hostname is same as the ip address. This is not the case always
and we should pass the correct IPv4/IPv6 address of the host to
avoid this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1955668

Change-Id: Ic79815972e654a8bfe2775f57c68cfa0bf115e2f
"}]
commit_message:
Pass valid IP address to os-brick

While fetching connector information the cinder driver of
glance-store is passing 'hostname' as IP address whereas it
actually needs IP address.

This path fetches the IPV4 or IPV6 address from the available
'hostname' and passes it to os-brick.

This worked for other cinder backends which don't rely specifically
on IP address for initializing connection like fibre channel, nfs etc
and even for some iscsi backends since, in some environments,
the hostname is same as the ip address. This is not the case always
and we should pass the correct IPv4/IPv6 address of the host to
avoid this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1955668

Change-Id: Ic79815972e654a8bfe2775f57c68cfa0bf115e2f

commit_message:
add redis package to gnocchi.

when incoming driver used is redis - which is typical in big/public
cloud deployments, without this package, the installation is stuck
on db sync operation and never times out

Closes-Bug: 1955676
Change-Id: I451dbcda0d752cc7cdeaeae44f4ea9832d6c7bfc

In Python 3.10, "Optional arguments" becomes "Options". This
patch fixes that. FYI, this was reported against my Debian package:

https://bugs.debian.org/1002431

and currently, the package build against Python 3.9 and 3.10, so
I'm sure this patch works in both cases.

Change-Id: I76dc4077dde648d1a5589b49bf697470063ca2c1
'}]
commit_message:
Python 3.10: Subcomand help test fix

In Python 3.10, "Optional arguments" becomes "Options". This
patch fixes that. FYI, this was reported against my Debian package:

https://bugs.debian.org/1002431

and currently, the package build against Python 3.9 and 3.10, so
I'm sure this patch works in both cases.

Change-Id: I76dc4077dde648d1a5589b49bf697470063ca2c1

commit_message:
Enhance NFV SOL_v3 LCM operation

This specification supports a new version of VNF lifecycle management APIs
complying with ETSI NFV SOL v3.
It adds a new version of APIs involved in operating instantiated VNF instances
(scale, heal, modify, and change external vnf connectivity).

Co-authored-By: Hirofumi Noguchi <hirofumi.noguchi.rs@hco.ntt.co.jp>
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-scale-vnf
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-heal-vnf
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-modify-vnf
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-change-external-connectivity
Change-Id: Ib8910e549076d0fe782909dfe702976948a5461f

Updating python testing classifier as per Yoga testing runtime

testing as voting. Unit tests update are handled by the
job template change in openstack-zuul-job

this commit updates the classifier in setup.cfg file.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/yoga.html

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this topic was
discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to to test lower-constraints
[1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I02c79a8f16b2d7098d419fc46d44d9c04731610d
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable"

This reverts commit 6307c84e83530ab27124ab9e6a8117ee44069614.

NOTE(elod.illes): devstack in Rocky is fixed and grenade jobs started
to pass in Stein. We can enable grenades again to restore testing as it
was before.

Change-Id: I9693b71038f91d976ac82e768697001a4dc80e05

commit_message:
fix incorrect override IPOrHost

There is a not functional code part. With this unit test,
IPOrHost function was valid for an IP, but not for a hostname
Here is the fix + the unit test

Change-Id: I8881043eaa670ea3ddea8afd728b83370b991618

commit_message:
Using Trigger-less to implemeting the OSM (1)

The Designate project need to merge OVO before implementing
this solution, It  will help to migrate DB Schema with minimal downtime.

This is other solution of OSM. And we should selective choices
between Trigger-based and Trigger-less in Designate project in the
future.

Object items:
  - zone
  - zone_attribute
  - zone_master
  - zone_export
  - zone_import
  - zone_attribute
  - zone_master
  - zone_transfer_accept
  - zone_transfer_request

Change-Id: I9340ce0658415eb3ab1ed11f014a2fd57c86bd22
Implements: blueprint designate-rolling-upgrade

subject: Using Trigger-less to implemeting the OSM (3)

commit_message:
Using Trigger-less to implemeting the OSM (3)

Object items:

  - blacklist
  - quota
  - record
  - recordset
  - service_status
  - tld
  - tsigkey
  - other objects

Change-Id: I1a0b51a84dcc268b52847c3daa5f75c441c35ad7
Implements: blueprint designate-rolling-upgrade

commit_message:
Using Trigger-less to implemeting the OSM (2)

Object items:
  - pool
  - pool_also_notify
  - pool_attribute
  - pool_manager_status
  - pool_nameserver
  - pool_ns_record
  - pool_target
  - pool_target_master
  - pool_target_option

Change-Id: I5de79739157dfef4e311ff53d5fe0307f4607ecd
Implements: blueprint designate-rolling-upgrade

commit_message:
Adding the option to set the zone quota to unlimited

by assigning negative value for the resource like -1

Change-Id: Iaeca2be8b38075e3e7e8f79621b4b41cbe9934f7
Closes-Bug: #1876198
(cherry picked from commit 12d50c7f5bafa113e70569c805d844b449976f36)

commit_message:
Eventlet bump + properly decode strings in py3x

Eventlet 0.20.0 does not work in Python36, due to a SSLContext bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1788253

With eventlet 0.21.0 (the fix), eventlet now returns str not bytes in
py3, so we need to determine the type before blindly decoding.

Change-Id: I0a11fc62a6574ef733074a7e5292054119812ac2

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in

commit_message:
Ensure coordination IDs are encoded

Ensure coordination IDs are encoded when working with coordination
backend. This fixes an issue when upgrading to Python 3 (where bytes
and str are different types) and _update_partitions() attempts to
sort types of 'str' and 'bytes', causing designate-producer to crash.

Change-Id: Id8206ee5285d3a73e00ef21b7d3961a29c23ab4b
Closes-Bug: #1828534
(cherry picked from commit 556a27e4e9c9c4e21fb0ea46d8d8832d28c85314)

commit_message:
Ensure coordination IDs are encoded

Ensure coordination IDs are encoded when working with coordination
backend. This fixes an issue when upgrading to Python 3 (where bytes
and str are different types) and _update_partitions() attempts to
sort types of 'str' and 'bytes', causing designate-producer to crash.

Change-Id: Id8206ee5285d3a73e00ef21b7d3961a29c23ab4b
Closes-Bug: #1828534
(cherry picked from commit 556a27e4e9c9c4e21fb0ea46d8d8832d28c85314)

subject: Add unique constraint to service_statuses
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6737, 'name': 'Edward Hope-Morley', 'email': 'edward.hope-morley@canonical.com', 'username': 'hopem'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2019-06-03 09:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-06-04 06:38:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think that backporting this DB migration to a stable branch is not advisable since it may fail when the existing data don't match the constraints."}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-06-04 09:38:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I think that backporting this DB migration to a stable branch is
 > not advisable since it may fail when the existing data don't match
 > the constraints.

I kinda agree, but not sure what is worse. If you hit this bug, it's dangerous to run Designate, as it will create an infinite (only limited by disk/memory) number of service records. Not sure which is better."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2019-06-04 17:49:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As has been stated, without this patch you can run into the problem of designate killing your database by flooding the service_statuses table. Upgrading to this patch only takes effect if the migration is executed and that will expectedly fail if you are hitting the bug. But isn't that actually useful? i.e. it serves as a red flag that you have a serious problem that needs resolving and the solution is documented in the LP bug. So personally I am favour of having this backported because whatever the outcome i believe it is advantageous to have this patch."}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2021-12-24 04:28:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-03 09:35:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add unique constraint to service_statuses

In the current implementation, if for any reason a duplicate
service entry gets created, the call to update that service
will fail endlessly, and instead cause the service to create
new entries everytime update_service_status gets called. Causing
it to fill the database with duplicate entries.

This patch adds a unique constraint to the service_statuses
table based on the service_name and hostname, to ensure that
this cannot happen.

In addition we add a new test to the storage driver and further
expanded the central service test coverage.

Change-Id: I307a8f7dd8b8a83effa447a846db3288efa32dba
Closes-Bug: #1768824
(cherry picked from commit 1924abff40341337bd00659ff01a14ea91701475)
'}]
commit_message:
Add unique constraint to service_statuses

In the current implementation, if for any reason a duplicate
service entry gets created, the call to update that service
will fail endlessly, and instead cause the service to create
new entries everytime update_service_status gets called. Causing
it to fill the database with duplicate entries.

This patch adds a unique constraint to the service_statuses
table based on the service_name and hostname, to ensure that
this cannot happen.

In addition we add a new test to the storage driver and further
expanded the central service test coverage.

Change-Id: I307a8f7dd8b8a83effa447a846db3288efa32dba
Closes-Bug: #1768824
(cherry picked from commit 1924abff40341337bd00659ff01a14ea91701475)

commit_message:
Add top-level CLI reference page in docs

This creates the top-level cli/ reference in the
docs and moves the designate-manage docs to that
CLI reference. A redirect is added for sending
old links to the new home for the designate-manage.html
page.

We'll build on this to add docs for the new
designate-status upgrade check command.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-20 16:50:20.000000000', 'message': "Clean up zone locking

Updated the decorator to log something more appropriate when locking during
zone creation. The existing implementation would log 'zone-None', this
changes it to 'create-new-zone'.

We also add a try/finally catch statement to make sure the lock is always
released when done.

* Changed lock name to be more appropriate when creating new zones.
* Implement try/finally pattern to make sure lock is always released.

Change-Id: I0c7b45d3125ff1e007d44064a7653c1b2b07c770
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up zone locking

Updated the decorator to log something more appropriate when locking during
zone creation. The existing implementation would log 'zone-None', this
changes it to 'create-new-zone'.

We also add a try/finally catch statement to make sure the lock is always
released when done.

* Changed lock name to be more appropriate when creating new zones.
* Implement try/finally pattern to make sure lock is always released.

Change-Id: I0c7b45d3125ff1e007d44064a7653c1b2b07c770

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-08 02:29:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix DBDeadLock error resulting into 500

When user requests the record registration request continuously,
sometimes designate hits DBDeadLock resuting into 500 InternalServerError.

We get below error:

2019-02-21 21:30:39.925 49752 ERROR designate.api.middleware RemoteError:
Remote error: DBDeadlock (pymysql.err.InternalError)
(1213, u'Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction')
[SQL: u'UPDATE records SET version=(records.version + %(version_1)s),
updated_at=%(updated_at)s, data=%(data)s, hash=%(hash)s, status=%(status)s,
action=%(action)s, serial=%(serial)s WHERE records.id = %(id_1)s']
[parameters: {'status': 'PENDING', 'hash': '39795ee18c6e3c9ad1c0190c6a3d8d4f',
'updated_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 2, 21, 12, 30, 39, 909846), u'version_1': 1,
u'id_1': '7a655eeda4d446cdaa81caf19ab55fcc', 'action': 'UPDATE',
'serial': 1550752338,
'data': u'ns2.example.jp. domain.example.com. 1550752338 3552 600 86400 3600'}]

In the process of record registeration, designate first tried to update
the reocrd and then update the zone status.

Updating the zone_status and registering the record process[1] and after synced
update record_status and zone_status process[2] are in reverse order. So If user
request the registering record many time and same time, Designate will get the
DBDeadLock, when these processes run the same time.

We observed that changing the order of the operations solves this issue.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L1292-L1320
[2] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L2310-L2322

1. transaction [1]-1 updating zone status process <- run    ---> table_name-zone
2. transaction [2]-1 updating record status process <- run  ---> table_name-record
3. transaction [1]-2 registering record process <- run and wait  ---> table_name-record
4. transaction [2]-2 updating zone process <-deadlock!           ---> table_name-zone

Change-Id: Icd6e690ac84a2fe0db0f4a8a513de47f7916f5ea
Related-Bug: #1785459
(cherry picked from commit f828654a3d40476cac7eb24a09a36e9978c2d708)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DBDeadLock error resulting into 500

When user requests the record registration request continuously,
sometimes designate hits DBDeadLock resuting into 500 InternalServerError.

We get below error:

2019-02-21 21:30:39.925 49752 ERROR designate.api.middleware RemoteError:
Remote error: DBDeadlock (pymysql.err.InternalError)
(1213, u'Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction')
[SQL: u'UPDATE records SET version=(records.version + %(version_1)s),
updated_at=%(updated_at)s, data=%(data)s, hash=%(hash)s, status=%(status)s,
action=%(action)s, serial=%(serial)s WHERE records.id = %(id_1)s']
[parameters: {'status': 'PENDING', 'hash': '39795ee18c6e3c9ad1c0190c6a3d8d4f',
'updated_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 2, 21, 12, 30, 39, 909846), u'version_1': 1,
u'id_1': '7a655eeda4d446cdaa81caf19ab55fcc', 'action': 'UPDATE',
'serial': 1550752338,
'data': u'ns2.example.jp. domain.example.com. 1550752338 3552 600 86400 3600'}]

In the process of record registeration, designate first tried to update
the reocrd and then update the zone status.

Updating the zone_status and registering the record process[1] and after synced
update record_status and zone_status process[2] are in reverse order. So If user
request the registering record many time and same time, Designate will get the
DBDeadLock, when these processes run the same time.

We observed that changing the order of the operations solves this issue.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L1292-L1320
[2] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L2310-L2322

1. transaction [1]-1 updating zone status process <- run    ---> table_name-zone
2. transaction [2]-1 updating record status process <- run  ---> table_name-record
3. transaction [1]-2 registering record process <- run and wait  ---> table_name-record
4. transaction [2]-2 updating zone process <-deadlock!           ---> table_name-zone

Change-Id: Icd6e690ac84a2fe0db0f4a8a513de47f7916f5ea
Related-Bug: #1785459
(cherry picked from commit f828654a3d40476cac7eb24a09a36e9978c2d708)

subject: Allow disabling OPTIONS method on server root, "/"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7065, 'name': 'Brad P. Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11069, 'date': '2018-10-12 13:10:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7065, 'date': '2018-11-06 13:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-03-18 10:50:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think adding an option to control OPTIONS is overkill and also makes it more difficult for consumers to receive a consistent behaviour from the API. I'm not 100% decided though between

a) just disable these statically
b) leave things as-is and tell people who care about security audits to insert a filtering proxy"}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2019-03-19 12:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think we are OK to leave this - I have started to work on the wsgi patc, wehn collapses this versions app into the main API app, and remove flask from it, which means it will not respond for OPTIONS (the default for pecan + OPTIONS is 405 AFAIK)'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2021-12-24 04:25:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-12 13:10:09.000000000', 'message': 'Allow disabling OPTIONS method on server root, "/"

To appease automated security audits that are concerned about a
web-based service volunteering too much information, allow disabling
Flask's OPTIONS method support with the `enable-options-method`
boolean configuration option (that defaults to "true" to maintain
Designate's default behavior).

Of course Flask is only used for the server root for advertising API
versions, so it is only applied and effective there, but it is
unnecessary elsewhere (ie `/v2` & `/admin`) as Pecan doesn't implement
the OPTIONS method nor does Designate (eg implementing
`_hander_options()`, `post_options()`, or `options()` on its
Pecan-based REST controllers).

Change-Id: Idd090435408cf86a01706b7fa463306d051d7ae1
Closes-Bug: #1796828
'}]
commit_message:
Allow disabling OPTIONS method on server root, "/"

To appease automated security audits that are concerned about a
web-based service volunteering too much information, allow disabling
Flask's OPTIONS method support with the `enable-options-method`
boolean configuration option (that defaults to "true" to maintain
Designate's default behavior).

Of course Flask is only used for the server root for advertising API
versions, so it is only applied and effective there, but it is
unnecessary elsewhere (ie `/v2` & `/admin`) as Pecan doesn't implement
the OPTIONS method nor does Designate (eg implementing
`_hander_options()`, `post_options()`, or `options()` on its
Pecan-based REST controllers).

Change-Id: Idd090435408cf86a01706b7fa463306d051d7ae1
Closes-Bug: #1796828

commit_message:
Enables MySQL Cluster Support for Designate

Implements minor fixes to the SQL Alchemy scripts in Designate to support the
MySQL Cluster DB. This includes the usage of the boolean mysql_enable_ndb
setting from oslo.db from bug 1564110. This allows operators to select from
MySQL (InnoDB) or MySQL Cluster (NDB) as the storage engine backend.

Change-Id: I11351517544108f9d1b8281039ef6f1cd312dba1
Implements: blueprint mysql-cluster-support
Depends-On: I9f1fd2a87fdf75332de2339d3ff4f08ce9220dcf

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 20104, 'name': 'Dmitrii Galkin', 'display_name': 'Dmitry Galkin', 'email': 'galkindmitrii@gmail.com', 'username': 'galkindmitrii'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}]

[{'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-01-22 17:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-01-25 08:05:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-01-25 11:41:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:31:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-02-16 10:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I'm wondering if we need microversions to do an API change like this.

Otherwise, how can a consumer know whether they are talking to an API that allows setting serials? Not sure if telling them "Just try it and see whether it works" is a valid answer.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

So, in Designate, we (traditionally - when the team make up was very different) have held a differing view on API compatiblity to other projects, namely that we will non backwards breaking changes.

My view would be that with microversions, we would give the user the same experience - that a system with an older version would fail to work.

I am open to debate on this though.

I did have a thought that we could make this a "task" on the zone, as we will probably need one at some point in the future to trigger a serial rollover anyway.

WIP'ing until we decide whats right to do'}, {'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2018-03-02 10:08:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

JFYI: tested this patch shortly. Turned out that when increment_serial is not True, the SOA record of the zone won't get updated.
 See: https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L495-L510 - the _update_soa() won't be called when increment_serial is empty."}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2021-12-24 04:25:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

subject: Allows to schedule DNS Zone to a non-default pool during Zone Import.
messages:
[{'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2017-12-03 19:34:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2017-12-03 21:09:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2017-12-04 16:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thanks Dimitry!

Unfortunately we do not allow users to specify an exact pool ID - we use a scheduler to find the right zone [1]

I suggest we implement a `Designate-Zone-Attributes` header. (We drop the "X-" prefix these days)[2]

It should take a comma separated key:value list like this:

  Designate-Zone-Attributes:  pool_level: gold, fast_ttl: true, pops: global

and then pass them as attributes on the zone being created to central

1 - https://docs.openstack.org/designate/latest/admin/pool-scheduler.html
2- http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/headers.html'}, {'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2017-12-04 17:18:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Graham,

Please correct me if I'm wrong, but there is a 'pool_id_attribute_filter' (https://docs.openstack.org/designate/latest/admin/pool-scheduler.html#pool-id-attribute-filter)

Which we use successfully and which allows to specify 'pool_id' in attributes during zone creation. But unfortunately not during the zone import because the request has 'text/dns' content type. 

Obviously, this implementation assumes that 'pool_id_attribute_filter' is enabled.

Also, according to my understanding of RFC2616: 
https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec4.html#sec4.2
 the header field-value may have multiple comma-separated values, but not multiple key-value pairs like:
pool_level: gold, fast_ttl: true, pops: global"}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-02-12 12:58:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

OK, this slipped off my radar.

I am not comfortable with allowing Pool-ID to be the only schedualer - I do not think it is a pattern we should allow.

Can we look at multipart mime types?

Adding a JSON section with attributes then the text/dns section would allow us to have the same experience for import as we have for create'}, {'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2018-02-15 10:23:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

OK, another problem that I've encountered is: https://bugs.launchpad.net/designate/+bug/1749669

Right now using 'attribute' and 'pool_id_attribute' filters will not allow schedule by pool_id at all.

I understand your idea, but this won't work until the problem mentioned above is resolved."}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2021-12-24 04:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-03 19:34:41.000000000', 'message': "Allows to schedule DNS Zone to a non-default pool during Zone Import.

This commit adds an option to specify designate pool_id during zone
import via 'X-Designate-Pool-ID' header. If a header was given along with
import request than the zone will receive the 'pool_id' attribute exactly
as it happens during new zone creation with 'pool_id' given in json attributes.

Closes-Bug: 1690184

Change-Id: I3864b59a6ba46c9532aa3f386a261c1450146156
"}, {'created': '2017-12-03 21:09:10.000000000', 'message': "Allows to schedule DNS Zone to a non-default pool during Zone Import.

This commit adds an option to specify designate pool_id during zone
import via 'X-Designate-Pool-ID' header. If a header was given along with
import request than the zone will receive the 'pool_id' attribute exactly
as it happens during new zone creation with 'pool_id' given in json attributes.

Closes-Bug: 1690184

Change-Id: I3864b59a6ba46c9532aa3f386a261c1450146156
"}]
commit_message:
Allows to schedule DNS Zone to a non-default pool during Zone Import.

This commit adds an option to specify designate pool_id during zone
import via 'X-Designate-Pool-ID' header. If a header was given along with
import request than the zone will receive the 'pool_id' attribute exactly
as it happens during new zone creation with 'pool_id' given in json attributes.

Closes-Bug: 1690184

Change-Id: I3864b59a6ba46c9532aa3f386a261c1450146156

Update hacking version

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-01-13 03:18:35.000000000', 'message': 'H402 hacking has been deprecated

H402 hacking have been removed since hacking 0.10.
https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/setup.cfg
test-requirements of kuryr-libnetwork require
hacking <0.11,>=0.10.0.
So remove H402 ignore statement.

Change-Id: Ifc3c66e9e9c70ab1fae1b36fd3ff021abeead959
'}, {'created': '2017-01-13 03:29:27.000000000', 'message': 'H402 hacking has been deprecated

H402 hacking have been removed since hacking 0.10.

So remove H402 ignore statement.

Change-Id: Ifc3c66e9e9c70ab1fae1b36fd3ff021abeead959
'}]
commit_message:
H402 hacking has been deprecated

H402 hacking have been removed since hacking 0.10.

So remove H402 ignore statement.

Change-Id: Ifc3c66e9e9c70ab1fae1b36fd3ff021abeead959

commit_message:
Remove greenlet useless requirement

This patch cleans up the requirements.txt list to remove greenlet module not used anymore.

Change-Id: Ie1c2ee9937d60156863ef4dcd6104db2cadfacc3
