commit_message:
Tweak port metadata test to be more reliable

This test was intended to verify that the metadata was correct for a
port created with one subnet and updated to include a second. It should
care that the fixed-ips exist from both subnets in the metadata, but
because the addresses were hardcoded, periodically the address generated
could be different and the match would fail spuriously. This patch fixes
that by dynamically detecting which addresses should exist on the
metadata as cidrs.

Change-Id: I58776aca3bce57f9b811877da8ae4ee199ee7c59
(cherry picked from commit 92a1646594c06698afeb861f8ab811ca8499f223)

commit_message:
Updating python testing as per Yoga testing runtime

Yoga testing runtime[1] has been updated to add py39
testing as voting and as we are testing py3.6 and py3.9
we do not need to test py3.7|8 explicitly. Unit tests update are
handled by the job template change in openstack-zuul-job

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/820286

this commit makes other required changes in zuul.yaml and
update the classifier in setup.cfg file.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/yoga.html

Change-Id: Ib4f4e6ceba58a94e512ca1f3329b2a4a6c5d02bd

See [1] for more details.

Re-read the partition table with 'partx -a', rather than 'partx -u'.

This should fix an timing issue where the bootloader installation
fails to mount the EFI partition from a whole disk image since it
is not yet aware of the new partitions (observed with both, the
iscsi and the direct deploy interface).

Change-Id: If5da3075e813ae01df3decf8f0647aba111b0515
(cherry picked from commit dc8c1f16f9a00e2bff21612d1a9cf0ea0f3addf0)

commit_message:
Re-read the partition table with partx -a

Re-read the partition table with 'partx -a', rather than 'partx -u'.

This should fix an timing issue where the bootloader installation
fails to mount the EFI partition from a whole disk image since it
is not yet aware of the new partitions (observed with both, the
iscsi and the direct deploy interface).

Change-Id: If5da3075e813ae01df3decf8f0647aba111b0515
(cherry picked from commit dc8c1f16f9a00e2bff21612d1a9cf0ea0f3addf0)
(cherry picked from commit ab3e8a75badf2719602b2416af9e3c19d7511c79)

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-10-15 09:35:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-10-22 14:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I don't know whether any of this needs to be addressed before approval into OpenStack, but I've noticed a number of divergences from OpenStack norms within skyline-apiserver which will make integration with our community goals, standard CI jobs, and release automation challenging for them:

  * Reimplements lots of common things from scratch rather than relying on Oslo (only minor use of oslo.policy currently)
  * Organized as a "monorepo" containing half a dozen Python packages (when splitting, be sure to use Git's filter-branch tool in order to preserve existing commit history)
  * Uses Git's submodule feature rather than loose cross-project interdependencies
  * Package versions are hard-coded into files instead of deriving from Git metadata/tags
  * Tox configuration is a naive wrapper around make
  * Dependencies and test dependencies are not tracked in requirements files
  * No global upper-constraints.txt integration for constraining dependencies to versions used by the rest of OpenStack

Note that these concerns are based on only a cursory skimming of the current repository, so there are likely a lot of other similarly nonconforming aspects I haven't spotted. I recommend the maintainers of this project review the templates from openstack/cookiecutter, as well as look at how the packaging and test boilerplate is done in established repositories like openstack/nova and openstack/oslo.config.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-10-27 19:13:43.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2021-11-15 14:32:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-14 16:32:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add Skyline as an official project

Skyline is an OpenStack dashboard optimized by UI and UE.
It has a modern technology stack and ecology, is easier for
developers to maintain and operate by users, and has higher
concurrency performance.

Here are two videos to preview Skyline:
- Skyline technical overview[1].
- Skyline dashboard operating demo[2].

Skyline has the following technical advantages:
1. Separation of concerns, front-end focus on functional design
   and user experience, back-end focus on data logic.
2. Embrace modern browser technology and ecology: React, Ant Design,
   and Mobx.
3. Most functions directly call OpenStack-API, the call chain is
   simple, the logic is clearer, and the API responds quickly.
4. Use React component to process rendering, the page display
   process is fast and smooth, bringing users a better UI and UE
   experience.

At present, Skyline has completed the function development of
OpenStack core component, as well as most of the functions of
VPNaaS, Octavia and other components.
corresponding automated test jobs[3][4] are also integrated on
Zuul, and there is good code coverage.
Devstack deployment integration has also been completed, and
integration of kolla and kolla-ansible will complete pending
patch[5][6] after Skyline becomes an official project.

Skyline’s next roadmap will be to cover all existing functions
of Horizon and complete the page development of other OpenStack
components.

[1] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ro8tROYKDlE
[2] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pFAJLwzxv0A
[3] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/project/opendev.org/skyline/skyline-apiserver
[4] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/project/opendev.org/skyline/skyline-console
[5] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/810796
[6] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/810566

Change-Id: Ib91a241c64351c5e69023b2523408c75b80ff74d

commit_message:
Add Skyline as an official project

Skyline is an OpenStack dashboard optimized by UI and UE.
It has a modern technology stack and ecology, is easier for
developers to maintain and operate by users, and has higher
concurrency performance.

Here are two videos to preview Skyline:
- Skyline technical overview[1].
- Skyline dashboard operating demo[2].

Skyline has the following technical advantages:
1. Separation of concerns, front-end focus on functional design
   and user experience, back-end focus on data logic.
2. Embrace modern browser technology and ecology: React, Ant Design,
   and Mobx.
3. Most functions directly call OpenStack-API, the call chain is
   simple, the logic is clearer, and the API responds quickly.
4. Use React component to process rendering, the page display
   process is fast and smooth, bringing users a better UI and UE
   experience.

At present, Skyline has completed the function development of
OpenStack core component, as well as most of the functions of
VPNaaS, Octavia and other components.
corresponding automated test jobs[3][4] are also integrated on
Zuul, and there is good code coverage.
Devstack deployment integration has also been completed, and
integration of kolla and kolla-ansible will complete pending
patch[5][6] after Skyline becomes an official project.

Skyline’s next roadmap will be to cover all existing functions
of Horizon and complete the page development of other OpenStack
components.

[1] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ro8tROYKDlE
[2] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pFAJLwzxv0A
[3] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/project/opendev.org/skyline/skyline-apiserver
[4] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/project/opendev.org/skyline/skyline-console
[5] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/810796
[6] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/810566

Change-Id: Ib91a241c64351c5e69023b2523408c75b80ff74d

commit_message:
Fix the id attr for share group type access repr

The correct attribute name for the share group type access
repr is share_group_type_id, not id. This patch set fixes that.

Closes-Bug: #1953670
Change-Id: I651f3cc6429801db4c04813a60ddb4ec2871f2a1
(cherry picked from commit dcb25e54e994568f955b7499e59dacecbee70fcb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-22 12:03:11.000000000', 'message': 'Disable TLS on VNC by default

Currently TLS for VNC is enabled by default, for existing
deployments this is an issue because changes do not apply
to running vms, meaning access to the console will be lost
until the VM is migrated or rebooted.

Notes will be added to OSA on how to enable TLS for VNC for
existing deployments.

This needs to be backported to Xena release.

Change-Id: I9666aa947154f2fb0be34b649edcd09badb9740e
'}]
commit_message:
Disable TLS on VNC by default

Currently TLS for VNC is enabled by default, for existing
deployments this is an issue because changes do not apply
to running vms, meaning access to the console will be lost
until the VM is migrated or rebooted.

Notes will be added to OSA on how to enable TLS for VNC for
existing deployments.

This needs to be backported to Xena release.

Change-Id: I9666aa947154f2fb0be34b649edcd09badb9740e

commit_message:
Switch rebuild_server cloud method to rely on proxy

- Switch conn.cloud._compute.rebuild_server to rely on the proxy layer
- Adapt proxy parameters of the rebuild_server to correspond to the
  reality:
  - name and admin_pass are optional params
  - image is mandatory param

Change-Id: I953476378d4e9fc558c126e6024e4d56031112a1

Switch cloud.compute.get_server_by_id to use proxy

Consume proxy layer in cloud.ompute.get_server_by_id

Change-Id: Ie6d1776d3bc641e4fbab7c73ca05017cd429d12f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-11 20:04:46.000000000', 'message': '[SVF]:Fix multiple lsiogrp,lsvdisk calls in Retype.

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] During Retype operation
there are multiple lsiogrp and lsvdisk calls
which can be optimized .

This patch fixes can optimize ssh calls by caching the
io_grp information and passing it as an argument to
_verify_retype_params function which can remove
get_volume_io_group function call inside
_verify_retype_params .

Change-Id: I98562783225523b6f7193edf499563b1b11daace
'}, {'created': '2021-12-02 10:52:45.000000000', 'message': '[SVF]:Fix multiple lsiogrp,lsvdisk calls in Retype.

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] During Retype operation
there are multiple lsiogrp and lsvdisk calls
which can be optimized .

This patch fixes can optimize ssh calls by caching the
io_grp information and passing it as an argument to
_verify_retype_params function which can remove
get_volume_io_group function call inside
_verify_retype_params .

Closes Bug: #1951250

Change-Id: I98562783225523b6f7193edf499563b1b11daace
'}]
commit_message:
[SVF]:Fix multiple lsiogrp,lsvdisk calls in Retype.

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] During Retype operation
there are multiple lsiogrp and lsvdisk calls
which can be optimized .

This patch fixes can optimize ssh calls by caching the
io_grp information and passing it as an argument to
_verify_retype_params function which can remove
get_volume_io_group function call inside
_verify_retype_params .

Closes Bug: #1951250

Change-Id: I98562783225523b6f7193edf499563b1b11daace

Revert "Increase the timeout for arm64 jobs"

This reverts commit 4eada8932c535df3fb59b3bcae397fc1f8e3f4a9.

jobs were running in both check and check-arm64 pipelines,
with revert that will also be fixed.

commit_message:
Revert "Increase openstack-tox-py38 and openstack-tox-py39 timeouts"

This reverts commit 4f95794d2298d4872ec1ebb1380537d09b47ea91.

Reason for revert: Timeout increase no longer needed post fix[1], also openstack-tox-py39 running in gate pipeline too post [2], so it shouldn't run as non-voting only in the check pipeline.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/819117
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/818609

Change-Id: I49c53bea6e73991110d915741efff6dad5016241
Related-Bug: #1949476
Related-Bug: #1949704

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-25 09:05:30.000000000', 'message': "docs: update service configuration

The term 'project' is used to refer to an OpenStack project, e.g. nova.
This term is overloaded in OpenStack. Let's switch to another
undoubtedly overloaded term, component, but one at least that has a less
specific meaning in OpenStack.

Closes-Bug: #1916680

Change-Id: If7ddb1e7a455b307f45891eec6b975ed1ae6d11b
"}]
commit_message:
docs: update service configuration

The term 'project' is used to refer to an OpenStack project, e.g. nova.
This term is overloaded in OpenStack. Let's switch to another
undoubtedly overloaded term, component, but one at least that has a less
specific meaning in OpenStack.

Closes-Bug: #1916680

Change-Id: If7ddb1e7a455b307f45891eec6b975ed1ae6d11b

[OVN] Chassis name (OVS system-id) must be a UUID formatted string

metadata agent will log the error and exit.

commit_message:
[DNM] Test scenario jobs with kvm

I see in past it was done with [1] but
was reverted due to nested virt issues.
But now we have nested virt nodes available(the capacity
still needs to be checked) and since
currently tests fails randomly at ssh timeouts so let's
try the switch now and see how much it helps.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/190755866c6dbbd735dcae3ee9434c8f03722763

Change-Id: Iffe716867d8dce4789a60f671e6b70e7e479ba42

commit_message:
[OVN] Accept OVS system-id as non UUID formatted string

Accept OVS system-id non UUID formatted strings. The OVN metadata
agent will generate a unique UUID from the OVS system-id. If this
string is a UUID, this value will be used. If not, the OVN metadata
agent will generate a UUID based on the provided string.

This patch amends [1].

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/819634

Closes-Bug: #1952550

Change-Id: I42a8a767a6ef9454419b26f80339394759644faf

commit_message:
ovn: configure ovn in ovsdb only on ovn-controller hosts

Based on some variables like tunnel_interface_address that are not present in nodes without ovn-controller like controller nodes this task will be failed because of undefined variable

Signed-off-by: Seena Fallah <seenafallah@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic511bf6479438f9288a008afb2aae43083a4e69f
Closes-Bug: #1953367
(cherry picked from commit e4af0c03d2b649d9671fbafb9aae2fd0515e73ca)

In [1] the parameter mkisofs_cmd was introduced in puppet-nova to set
this parameter as CentOS Stream 9 requires a different value that the

commit_message:
Override default mkisofs_cmd in CentOS 9.

In [1] the parameter mkisofs_cmd was introduced in puppet-nova to set
this parameter as CentOS Stream 9 requires a different value that the
default one.

This change overrides the default value in CentOS9 so that no
additional tuning is needed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-nova/+/810932

(cherry picked from commit 39d206911997c4208baae6f2220e7756fdb985c7)
Change-Id: Ie4ffe01ba0172569009bea35f56f409065a6cf1b

subject: Fix import from collections
messages: [{'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2021-12-22 10:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-22 10:22:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix import from collections

Importing Iterator and Iterable from collections has been deprecated for
years, and is now failing under Python 3.10. This patch fixes the path.

Change-Id: I4d3f45c54c5381e1f110ae993e0f147147f3a891
'}]
commit_message:
Fix import from collections

Importing Iterator and Iterable from collections has been deprecated for
years, and is now failing under Python 3.10. This patch fixes the path.

Change-Id: I4d3f45c54c5381e1f110ae993e0f147147f3a891

commit_message:
Support creating members without a subnet ID

Since subnet ID is an optional API argument, if not
available the provider driver will now attempt to look
it up via the pool ID that is required.

Closes-bug: #1896677
Change-Id: Iec17b36ce38be89f83a45ea3ef4c652e837c69c5

[{'created': '2021-11-17 02:18:56.000000000', 'message': 'Only install required/supported fence agents

Now that the hardened whole-disk image is the default, installing only
the required fence agents will avoid agents which depend on packages
which the openstack-secure element will delete (specifically, telnet).

Change-Id: I835511b960df09bd05bd8aaf1695757f0b079c12
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
'}]
commit_message:
Only install required/supported fence agents

Now that the hardened whole-disk image is the default, installing only
the required fence agents will avoid agents which depend on packages
which the openstack-secure element will delete (specifically, telnet).

Change-Id: I835511b960df09bd05bd8aaf1695757f0b079c12
Blueprint: whole-disk-default

subject: fix(ci): Remove useless mirror_info.sh empty script
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-20 15:49:05.000000000', 'message': 'fix(ci): Remove useless mirror_info.sh empty script

We were creating an empty script called `mirror_info.sh` in `/etc/ci`
which is actually optional for zuul. Moreover, developers need to create
it locally in their workstation in order to run the molecule tests
locally.

This patch removes everything regarding this script.

JIRA: #VALFRWK-702

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6cb8a5bb87edeeee18ab0ec98477fb922aefa630
'}]
commit_message:
fix(ci): Remove useless mirror_info.sh empty script

We were creating an empty script called `mirror_info.sh` in `/etc/ci`
which is actually optional for zuul. Moreover, developers need to create
it locally in their workstation in order to run the molecule tests
locally.

This patch removes everything regarding this script.

JIRA: #VALFRWK-702

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6cb8a5bb87edeeee18ab0ec98477fb922aefa630

commit_message:
PoC: Add new manager role support

Currently the manager role support in the keystone bootstrapping process
is not available in keystone[1].

Adding it in devstack to check some SRBAC glance tempest tests with
'manager' persona support.

NOTE: This patch is here just to ensure that glance tests are working
      for manager role

Depends-On: Ida889aa30d462443b801c0f524c51f54b8b756d5
Change-Id: I4a0d82bfeb51da0b9cc6f00346ef576f8dfedc96

I like the change but it might affect operators relying on it. We need a least an upgrade release note.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-30 10:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Fabian, will you add reno for this ? I also like the change.'}, {'account_id': 22437, 'date': '2021-12-22 07:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-15 11:11:30.000000000', 'message': 'Don't enforce metadata-api to run on dhcp-agents

force_metadata will always run metadata-api on dhcp-agents. This is not the
upstream default and may lead to problems if dhcp-agent fails, f.e.
requests may fail or run into timeouts.

Instead we should not set force_metadata and just keep
"enable_isolated_metadata", this will switch between metadata-api running on
routers (if available) or dhcp-agent (if there is no router).

Now your metadata-api will failover if you run a l3-ha-router.

Change-Id: Idcc60590f0fdced23becbf8ef6a7877a08d7dc87
Closes-Bug: 1872960
'}]
commit_message:
Don't enforce metadata-api to run on dhcp-agents

force_metadata will always run metadata-api on dhcp-agents. This is not the
upstream default and may lead to problems if dhcp-agent fails, f.e.
requests may fail or run into timeouts.

Instead we should not set force_metadata and just keep
"enable_isolated_metadata", this will switch between metadata-api running on
routers (if available) or dhcp-agent (if there is no router).

Now your metadata-api will failover if you run a l3-ha-router.

Change-Id: Idcc60590f0fdced23becbf8ef6a7877a08d7dc87
Closes-Bug: 1872960

commit_message:
ovn: configure ovn in ovsdb only on ovn-controller hosts

Based on some variables like tunnel_interface_address that are not present in nodes without ovn-controller like controller nodes this task will be failed because of undefined variable

Signed-off-by: Seena Fallah <seenafallah@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Updating python testing classifier as per Yoga testing runtime

Yoga testing runtime[1] has been updated to add py39
testing as voting. Unit tests update are handled by the
job template change in openstack-zuul-job

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/820286

this commit updates the classifier in setup.cfg file.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/yoga.html

Change-Id: I47c7cb6fbf411823be4eef0240edbe1d59549588

[{'created': '2021-12-21 22:13:20.000000000', 'message': "slo: Default allow_async_delete to true

We've had this option for a year now, and it seems to help. Let's enable
it for everyone. Note that Swift clients still need to opt into the
async delete via a query param, while S3 clients get it for free.

Change-Id: Ib4164f877908b855ce354cc722d9cb0be8be9921
"}]
commit_message:
slo: Default allow_async_delete to true

We've had this option for a year now, and it seems to help. Let's enable
it for everyone. Note that Swift clients still need to opt into the
async delete via a query param, while S3 clients get it for free.

Change-Id: Ib4164f877908b855ce354cc722d9cb0be8be9921
